channel.title: Help :/
channel.description:
I bought a wig so I could look like a girl.
Me n davidude go into chat rooms and chat, and I wanted to have a webcam, so I bought one.
It is a microsoft vx-1000 I'm running vista.
On the back it says
"To work with Windows Vista download the software at www.microsoft.com/hardware/downloads"
My question How do I know why bit I am(the choice is 32 and 64)
When i put the disc in, it wont open the program for the download...
Help?

item.title: Help :/
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Casey.:

I think I had to make it vista compatible

Which means you got it working now?

Read full topic

item.title: Help :/
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

davidude36:

you may be able to instead of auto run the cd extract the drivers and install them manualy (although i wouldnt have a clue how to do this)

Install new hardware>Have disk> Look in removable media

I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Help :/
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

you may be able to instead of auto run the cd extract the drivers and install them manualy (although i wouldnt have a clue how to do this)

Are you sure the webcam needs drivers? when i had my old webcam u just plugged it in and windows detected it and it ran usually its only software that comes on cds that like is used to take still photos

Read full topic

item.title: Help :/
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

I think if you 64 bit it would say on your computer, assuming its pre-built. And if you have a CD goto “My Computer” and right click on the cd and hit “Explore” then look for ‘autorun’ or ‘install’.

Read full topic

hmmm your most probably 32 bit, have u tryed downloading either of the choices? AND WOOP WE CAN CHAT TO THE BALD GUY
